column1: full, inswinging attempted yorker, met on the full and tapped to mid-off with the full face
back of a length, slight angle into the corridor, sliced with a high elbow for a single to third man
some bounce, a mix-up, but Rahane is quickly through for the single and after Dhawan drops this angled bouncer behind point with soft hands
good length, no movement, slight width and left alone
136kph, length ball angled in at off stump, solidly defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, gets behind the line and opens the face to punch this past cover...it bobbles on the spongy outfield, doesn't go too far beyond the circle
back of a length at middle stump, spits up at Rahane who takes his bottom hand off and fends in front of his thigh guard. Trickles down to fine leg off the glove
back of a length, slanted across off stump, gets on top of the bounce and once more it's a soft-handed defence for a single in the point region
angled down leg side at a length, tucked off the hips to fine leg
full outside off stump, barely any feet from Dhawan as he looks for a big cover drive. Slow pitch, and he's through early. The bat turns in his hand and it dribbles gently to mid-off
big appeal, but big inside edge. This one swings in viciously from a length and strikes Dhawan in front of leg. Probably going down too
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot with an angled bat
shot. Marginally short and wide, and enough time for Rahane to hold his shape and get leg side of this before carving it behind point
back of a length at off stump, closes the face too early on the attempted glance, it falls pitch-side
good length, angled in at the pads,clipped straight to fine leg

Dhawan has a single digit score after nine 50-over innings for India. A tame shot. This is slightly short and climbing in the corridor. He arches back and looks to lift this over to the third man region - not clever, considering third man is in place. He finds him perfectly
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side with the outside half of the bat
ooh, yes. More bounce. This is steep from back of a length, and would have had a fending Kohli in trouble if it weren't wide outside off and moving further away
good length outside off stump, nice forward stride to leave it alone
back of a length outside off stump, shape away, left alone again
back of a length, angled in at off stump, straightens slightly and squares him up as he defends into the off side
short and wide outside off, skids through quickly from under his attempted cut shot

well, he had to get a boundary there eventually. Good length, angled into Rahane's pads once more and this time he has reached out enough, and timed the closing of his wrists properly. Four past the keeper
some outswing, but too short and wide outside off stump. Rahane lets it go
back of a length at off stump, gets behind the line, pokes it into the off side, steals the single
another awkward bouncer, this one headed for Rahane's ribs. Takes his eyes off the ball along with the bottom hand off the bat, survives
good length, leg stump, plays this one later than the earlier ones and tucks it past square leg to pick up the double
shot. Inconsistent bowling, and he's made to pay. Short and wide now, Rahane quickly in position and it's a regal slap through point
good length, just outside off stump, left alone
good length at off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, left alone, nice carry through
back of a length again, just outside off stump. Trying to draw that poke from Kohli, but he's happy to leave. For now.
goes after it this time. Good length ball, swinging away outside off stump, but the stride is big and he drives this firmly to covers
back to short of a length, just outside off stump, Kohli chases again but it's a mistimed bunt into the off side
heave your sighs, West Indian fans. Follows up a nice set up outside off stump with a full toss at leg stump that is duly flicked to the square leg boundary
overpitched, middle stump, slight shuffle before looking to flick this. The timing is missing. Midwicket cleans up to his right
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length outside off stump, Rahane leans in for the cover drive, then checks his shot. He wasn't to the pitch. Slices it to cover point
good length, angled in at off stump, solidly behind it to defend back down the pitch
back of a length at leg stump, clipped off the hips, straight to fine leg
good length, off stump, shuffle across, line covered, solidly defended
good length at middle stump, defended off the inside half of the bat, not fully in control, but fully safe in the end
nice. Back of a length, slight shape away from the corridor, left alone
full outside off stump, big stride to push this to mid-off. Then holds his shape and wonders whether that should have been driven
good length, off stump, dropped into the off side for a quick single
oh hurries him. Good line and length. So far. This jumps at Kohli as he looks to defend off the back foot, just outside off and climbs past the bat

in the air but Kyle Hope has overrun at backward point! Oh, that's some misjudgement. Holder gets another short one to climb outside off, Kohli fends at it aimlessly and gets it off the shoulder of the bat. Hope is too excited as this lobs up in the air and runs in too quickly; he's diving backwards and to his left in the end. It's a single to third man. Holder was certain he had got his counterpart
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
brace yourselves. Another bouncer in the corridor and this time Kohli goes for the hook. Comprehensively beaten. He's an annoyed man now, is Kohli
back of a length outside off stump, watchfully left alone

back of a length at middle stump, shuffles across and tucks this off his mid-riff to square leg. Rahane wants the run, but he's sent back. Gets in between the stumps and the throw on his way back, but it wasn't intentional
ah, he's camping on the back foot now and he gets a short ball at leg stump. On his toes quickly, and whips this fine with agile hands
shot. Straight to mid-off. Leans in nicely on this full ball outside off stump
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the off side with soft hands, good running
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, open-faced defence into the gully region

oh good catch! Kyle Hope has made amends! Back of a length outside off stump, he's on the front foot early and then he sees this lift up off the pitch. It's chest height and he pokes at it. Thick outside edge that hangs to the left of gully for a moment, before the fielder there, Hope, leaps one-handed to his left and gets rid of Kohli. Holder has his man
short ball at the ribs, middle stump-ish, he jumps up to tuck this behind square, can't get it past the keeper
good length, corridor, defended to point with an open face

hello! There's something in this pitch at the moment. This is slanted across off stump, back of a length. Yuvraj wants to defend off the back foot, but the bat is barely offered as this fizzes past the outside edge
good length, off stump, solidly defended into the off side
back of a length at middle stump, turned off his thigh to deep square
short ball, aimed for the throat, but not quite quick enough for this pitch. Yuvraj inside the line as he ducks this
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square
short ball, has Rahane jumping, but it's too far wide outside off stump
full outside off stump, defended into the off side off the front foot
short and angled across the corridor, there's that bounce again, and it takes the ball past the attempted pull shot
back of a length, starts on leg stump, swings further down and past the flick
back of a length, just outside off stump, defended into the off side and Rahane responds
short ball outside off stump, Rahane is quick to get his arms out of the way. Has he decided to play the opening bowlers out? A change coming soon, surely
short and wide outside off stump, left alone
short ball aimed for off stump, Rahane is nervous as he defends this. The bat is up early and he's barely looking at it as he fends
back of a length outside off stump, watches it onto the bat and drops it in front of gully...who is quick to release but can't hit the stumps as Yuvraj tries to makes his ground
back of a length, pitches outside off, nips in and flies through to the keeper as Rahane lets it go
back of a length in the corridor, hits the bat hard as he defends off the back foot
good length, just outside off, tapped gently on the up into the covers
back of a length outside off stump, mistimed back foot punch, straight back to the bowler
goes for the cut after a long time, and gets a thick outside edge. This skidded through from back of a length. It's flat off the bat and lands before third man gets to it
good length at leg stump, whipped to deep square leg
tossed up at off stump, gets to the pitch, drives to long-off
back of a length, pushed through flat at middle stump, poked to midwicket
floated full outside off stump, a controlled drive to long-off
a flowing cover drive. Gets to the pitch outside off stump, extends the arms, gets it wide of sweeper cover. Sluggish outfield
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
good length, flat, middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length, angled down leg
edge flies past the keeper. Back of a length, climbing in the corridor as he slashes at this. A healthy outside edge, but there's no slip
back of a length outside off stump, a more controlled cut this time, squeezes it betwee point and cover point
short ball, corridor, drops the bat, lets it go

yikes. Sharp bounce. This is dug in short, but I don't think he expected it to get that high when delivered it. Rahane gets everything out of the way outside off, falls to the floor, as he leaves this
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, off stump, defended to point off the front foot
good length at middle stump, forward defence
good length, middle stump, tickled through square leg off the front foot
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side on the up
good length at off stump, stride forward, flicked through square leg
drifted in at leg stump, overpitched, punched to long-on
back of a length outside off, back foot punch straight to extra cover
length ball slanted away from the left-hander's off stump. Yuvraj plays with an open bat face, wide of gully
back of a length, close to off stump, stabbed down to third man
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, opens his bat face to push into the point region
short now, rising just over waist high, angling into the body. Rahane pulls to deep square leg

oh man. No slip in place, and this one goes through that vacant space at chest height. Back of a length, angling into the corridor. Again Yuvraj goes for that open-faced steer, and this one bounces a touch extra and flies off the edge
and again, that uncertain flirt outside off stump. Gets it to move away off the seam slightly from just back of a length, and it slides past the outside edge
flat, shortish, just outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
fullish on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
length ball, drifts in from around the wicket and continues on with that angle. Plays for the turn in defence, the ball slides into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
back of a length, close to off stump, dabbed towards backward point
length ball, goes with the arm towards off stump, defended with soft hands into the off side - may have bounced a touch extra
loses his line a little, slides down the leg side
back to that off-stump line, Yuvraj defends from a half-forward position
shortish, angling into Rahane's body. Hops in the air, tucks it off his hip down to fine leg
back of a length outside off, stabbed to point
length ball in the corridor, Yuvraj trusts the angle from right-arm over and leaves it alone
shorter now, and he takes one good step back, and the angle gives him just the width he needs to roll his wrists over and cut to the left of backward point
full, just outside off stump. Yuvraj dives firmly and Lewis dives left at cover to stop it
slower ball, full outside off. Rahane leaves it alone
sees some flight outside off and steps out to drive to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, goes deep in his crease and punches to the right of backward point
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
angles into the pads this time, clipped through square leg
floated up just outside off, steered towards backward point
quicker and flatter, just outside off. Goes back, looks for the soft-hands single towards point, but the keeper dashes out to deny Rahane
short, sits up at chest height on off stump. Yuvraj barely moves, just swivels, meets it on top of the bounce, and pulls to the deep midwicket boundary
length ball close to off stump, defended firmly to cover
again that dangerous open-faced steer. Back of a length, slanting into the corridor, waits and steers to third man
another full slower ball outside off, another leave from Rahane. The ball rolls through to Shai Hope
another slower ball outside off, this time Rahane gets a big stride forward and punches to mid-off

ooh, good ball. Bangs it in short and angles it in from wide of the crease. Rahane bends down low at the knees, sways his upper body away from the line, and keeps his eye on the ball, looking to ramp it to third man. Can't put bat to ball, though
full on off and middle, driven to long-on
flat, angling into middle stump, goes back to clip through square leg
back of a length on middle stump, punches with a nice, straight bat to long-on
flighted and full on off stump, clipped to long-on
down the track now to the tossed-up ball on middle and off, looks to clip to long-on and short midwicket dives to get in the way
quicker now, on off stump, defended to short cover
quickish and full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover
back of a length on off and middle. This time Rahane swings his front leg out of the way and pulls down to long-on

tosses it up and gets it to dip onto a good length on leg stump. Beats the inside edge as he comes forward to defend, hits front pad. Probably sliding down leg. Hang on, ball-tracking suggests it was hitting middle stump. Didn't turn as much as I thought. Not much of an appeal at all
back of a length now, punched to midwicket
tossed up nicely on middle stump, gets a good stride forward to defend
down the track now, whips with the turn from off stump to the right of midwicket
tossed up full on off stump. Drives, looking to hit towards long-off, the bowler moves quickly to his right to intercept
on middle and off now, driven to long-on
back of a length, skids through quickly and hits Rahane's in front of middle stump as he tries to play across the line. Probably an inside-edge, again not much of an lbw appeal
fuller now, driven to long-on
top-edge, but that's in the gap. Sweeps from middle and leg, and it was a little too quick for him to get down fully. Ball bounces a touch extra. Into the gap to the right of short fine leg
shortish and flat on leg stump, punched to long-on
back of a length, tucks him up for room, punched to midwicket
this one's more on off stump and he goes back and makes room to punch through cover
full now, on leg stump, shows the full face to push to long-on
short, a bit of width, slapped to sweeper cover
length ball on leg stump, gets forward to clip into the square leg region
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to the right of short third man
down the track now, not quite to the pitch of this quickish ball, blocks it back to the bowler
flat on off stump, stays back to defend into the covers
a bit of flight outside off, comes out of his crease to drive to cover
shhortish, some width, chopped to short third man
quickish length ball just outside off, stays back to stab into the covers
flat, just outside off, looks to make room to cut but it isn't short enough. Bends low to chop into the cover point region

lbw appeal, much louder this time, as Yuvraj comes forward hesitantly to defend. Given not out, they've reviewed this time... Again Bishoo gets it to dip onto a lovely length - straightens just enough to clip the front pad before it hits Yuvraj's inside edge. He's only half forward. Pitches just inside the line, leg-stumpish, and ball-tracking says it's hitting off stump. Excellent delivery, not the greatest technique against spin, and Yuvraj has to go
good ball first up, flighted, just outside off. Dhoni isn't fully forward to drive, compensates with a roll of his bottom wrist to play that towards short extra-cover
quicker now, a little closer to off stump, jabbed towards short extra-cover again
a bit more flight and he's out of his crease to push down to long-on
back of a length, slides on with the angle towards off stump. Rahane wants to punch through cover point but he's cramped for room, plays it a short distance to the left of the bowler instead
back of a length, angling into middle and leg. Lets it come on and tucks it into the square leg region
short, angling into the ribs. Rahane jumps to ride the bounce and drops it down into the leg side with soft hands
shortish on leg stump. Jumps across and flicks off his hip to long leg
shortish again, angling into the body, Rahane works it down to long leg
a bit of bounce from just back of a length, angling into off stump. Dhoni drops his bottom hand while defending and it hits the bat handle, drops softly into the leg side
short outside off, Dhoni pulls to deep square leg
short outside off, chopped away to deep point
short and wide once more, slapped to sweeper cover
down the track now and Bishoo bowls it full and fairly wide outside off. Dhoni jumps across and clips to midwicket
short outside off, cut away to that man at deep point/sweeper cover again
seems to be his stock ball for the over, short and wide. This time it doesn't quite come on. Rahane slaps it straighter than previously and Lewis dives left from extra-cover to stop it
back of a length, closer to off stump, punched to long-off
shortish, angling in from wide of the crease and denying Rahane room to cut. Chops it down to backward point
shortish outside off, gets on his toes to dab it down to third man and bring up fifty
shortish on off stump, played down to midwicket with a turn of the wrists
short in the corridor, jumps to ride the bounce and stabs it into the gap between backward point and cover point. Prioritised placement over power there, deft use of the hands
shortish, angling into off stump, uses the angle to work it down to long leg

ooh, that's awkward from Dhoni. Short, rising ball in the fifth-stump channel, and Dhoni, for some reason, jumped across and closed his bat face to play into the on side. Thick outside edge runs away to the third man boundary. Looks like the ball jammed his right thumb into the handle
full, flat, wide of off, left alone
wide-ish, just back of a length, leans back to cut, gets a thick outside edge wide of the keeper
slower and fuller now, driven to long-off
back of a length on off stump, rocks back, makes room, and punches to cover point
ooh, sneaks through. Not short or wide enough to cut and it goes under his angled bat
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
back of a length, angling down leg, hits Rahane's thigh pad as he misses the flick
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to extra-cover
short, angling into the body, swivels to pull to long leg
ooh, extra bounce outside off. Short, Rahane wanted to pull, and he half-aborted the shot as the ball rose above his shoulder
short again, this one doesn't get up much, only to hip height. Keeps his eye on it and plays a controlled pull down to long leg
digs it in again, this time it gets up to neck height. Angled into the body again and he's off his feet, drops his bottom hand, and keeps it down well enough despite fending a little awkwardly at it
ooh, Dhoni in a tangle again. Flat and full on off stump. Looks to jab into the covers without much of a front-foot stride. Goes with the angle and hits his inside edge, rolls into the leg side
not too much room to cut, stabbed to backward point
this one's wider but he cuts straight to backward point
full and flighted wide of off, left alone
a touch short outside off, chopped into the cover point region
back of a length outside off, punched to extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, jumps back and across to defend towards mid-on
short, rising to shoulder height, plays a half-pull, half defensive jab down to midwicket
straighter now, tucked off the hip to fine leg

getting a little predictable with his length here, and Rahane may have premeditated a little. Short, rising over off stump, and he cleared his front leg almost before Holder had delivered, and swivelled to pull, just about clears the forward square leg boundary. Hits the cushions on the full, actually
looks for that ramp over the keeper this time. He likes that shot whenever it's short and rising outside off. Couldn't put bat on ball this time
back of a length, close to off stump, punched back towards the bowler
short and wide, chopped straight to point
good length, slides through outside off stump and under Dhoni's attempted slice
back of a length, pushed through flat, mistimed back foot punch goes straight to extra cover
slides another one wide, this one is past the wide marker
back of a length outsdie off stump, reaches out and pokes this to extra cover
good length, fourth stump, thick outside edge as he looks to bludgeon this
back of a length outside off stump, finds a deep-ish extra cover with the back foot punch
short outside off stump, hurries him on the back foot, finds extra cover with the punch
drags this good length ball from outside off with a sweep, hits it straight to square leg
full at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
good length, flat at middle stump, puts his front leg across and clips this wide of mid-on
back of a length outside off stump, punched forcefully off the back foot, straight to long-off
good length ball, it's flat and he has to put a lot of effort to reach it after stepping out. Does so, barely, and turns it to deep square leg
jumps down the track, meets the good length ball at the pitch, drives to long-off
and out comes the big swing. Not quickly enough. He's yorked outside off stump. Jams it into the pitch and back to the bowler
slider, full and wide outside off stump, Dhoni shoulders arms, it was just inside the marker
short ball, slid through outside off stump, under-edges the cut into the off side
smash. Anticipates the wide line, gets on one knee and meets this as it pitches. Brings down the axe on it and bisects the non-striker and the stumps. Long-on didn't move
short at middle stump, thumped off the back foot to long-on
full and drifted away from off stump, driven straight to extra cover
nicely placed. Another one drifted full outside off. This time he follows it with his hands and pokes it past backward point
good length, drifting away from off stump, thick outside edge on the push, straight to backward point
length, middle stump, flicked straight to square leg
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on off the meat
full and flat outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover
good length, wrong'un outsdie off stump, driven on the up to long-off
dropped short outside off stump, clubbed, flat-batted past the bowler. That off side field is impenetrable so he goes straight

well there is the slog and it's ended up being a top edge that neither midwicket - running back - nor long-on - running in - can get to. An old fashioned slog sweep gone wrong and in the end it's two caps and a ball on the floor
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover

dropped. Dhoni steps out, can't get to the pitch outside off stump. Swipes across the line and gets a leading edge that hangs agonisingly for backward point who dives to his left and can't hold on. Catchable.
yorker outsdie off stump, jammed out to extra cover
steps out, takes it on the full outside off, flicks straight to midwicket
good length at off stump, watches it onto the bat, drops it into the off side, no run
full ball, drifted wide outside off stump, drilled straight to extra cover
hangs back in his delivery stride, watches the batsman come out and fires a low full toss at middle stump. Flicked to deep midwicket
overpitched at middle stump, a bit of a flourish with the backlift, but it's gentle push to long-on in the end
good length at middle stump, Rahane not to the pitch, reaches out with his back leg in the air. All that and then he finds midwicket with the flick
back of a length outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover who has finally gone out for Dhoni
back of a length outside off stump, steps out and slices it uppishly to sweeper cover
oh come on. He's completely foxed the batsman but it's been called a wide. Saw him coming, pushed a legspinner wide. Dhoni quickly retracted and went back into the crease
catch it...says no one. Full ball outside off stump, gets under it and creams it over the bowler's head
back of a length outside off stump, cut to find sweeper cover
tossed up wide outside off stump. An ugly heave from Rahane. Gets the sweep off the toe to deep midwicket
short and wide outside off stump, turns slowly off the pitch and teases Dhoni. Would have been a wide but he has gone after it. Toe-ended anti-climactic butcher-cut...trickles to long-off
back of a length at leg stump, gets a glove as he looks to tickle this fine, keeper cleans up to his left
offcutter, good length, off stump. Rahane is down the pitch and adjusts for the pace, whips it wide of short fine
back of a length outside off stump, Dhoni sees third man in and goes for the late cut. But he finds that fielder, on the bounce, low to his left
legcutter this time, length outside off stump, punched on the up to sweeper cover
legcutter, good length, just outside off stump. Leans in, pokes it to point with an open face
good length, angled in at middle stump. Hits him on the thigh and there's a big appeal, but umpire deems bat was also involved as Rahane looked to flick with no feet
stage fright first up. Sees the batsman advance and fires this wayyyy wide outside off stump

back of a length with a lot of width. Rahane gets under it, hits it on the up to sweeper cover's right. Bishoo there is very nimble as he cuts it off inches from the boundary, on the bounce to his right. Flicks it back in, recovers and keeps it to two

sensational catch from Bishoo. Showed great awareness to his right the previous ball, and this time he jogs to his left from sweeper cover and times a dive perfectly to catch low to his left. Back of a length from Cummins, Rahane looked to find the gap over point, but there was no width, skewed it uppishly
back of a length outside off stump, Dhoni skips across to get inside the line and ramp it past short fine. Not enough connection, the fielder gets across to his left
what a shot. Overpitched outside off stump, in the slot for a cover drive. But Dhoni lets it come to him instead, then gets on his haunches as he opens the face to run this past point
yorker at off stump, tapped into the covers for a single
full outside off stump, flicks it to deep midwicket with the nonchalance of a man you'd think is batting on 300
legcutter, too full. A full toss, in fact, wide outside off stump. Driven to sweeper cover
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the front foot
nice. Offcutter, good length outside off stump. Jadhav was set to pick the midwicket boundary but was forced to poke at it outside off stump. Beaten on the outside edge in the end

hangs deep in the crease this time, anticipates the offcutter, and opens the face to perfection to run it past short third man. The fielder gives chase and pulls it back in with a tumble at the boundary
slower ball, full outside off stump, pushed to extra cover
steps out and gets awkwardly under a bouncer. Looking to hook it while also avoiding the impact. It hangs in the square leg region, where there's no fielder
camps outside the off stump, whips the full ball from out there, finds deep midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, flat-batted punch on the up, sweeper keeps it to one

camping outside off stump again and he shows why. He's seen a gap at the square leg boundary and this time he has picked it. Holder had no other go - had to follow the batsman. He was set up and he couldn't do much. It's a full toss in the end, and he sweeps it over the square leg fielder
this time he shuffles and stays leg side of the ball, picks it from outside and executes a square drive, gets it wide of third man
well bowled. Yorks him outside off stump. He looks to squeeze this through the off side, gets an inside edge onto pad that rolls behind the stumps
overpitched outside off stump, jams it out and finds sweeper cover to bring up his 63rd ODI fifty
slower ball, yorker at middle stump, dug out for a single to long-on
legcutter, full at off stump, squeezed out to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, cramps him, forces him to poke at it, and gives away only a single
slower bouncer. Jadhav runs down the pitch at it and swats hard. Can't make a connection. 3 off 4 this over.
attempted yorker, misses out. It's a low full toss at middle stump though, and he can't get under it. Single to long-on
slower ball, full at leg stump, walks at it and tries to flick. Gets it into the leg side off his pad

awwww yesssssss! It's Dhoni time. Stands tall, watches this slower ball fall into his arc outside off stump and brings down the hammer on it to lift it over the bowler's head before swiveling to show signs of life

superb. Superb. That square leg boundary is still open for Holder and Dhoni picks it with a powerful shovel. This ball was overpitched outside off, like the last one, but the swivel comes early this time and the bat swing takes it over the ropes
full outside off stump, chopped down to third man
slower ball, yorker outside off stump. Shuffles and misses out on the room, tries to chop it late to third man. Gets an inside edge into the pitch and through to the keeper
slower ball outside off stump, full and close to the batsman, who can only hit this to long-off
cruel from Dharmasena. This one swings back in from a length outside off, and looks like it's inside the marker as Dhoni lets it go
shuffles across, bludgeons the full ball from outside off to long-off's left, but Rovman puts in a good, timely dive to keep that to two
legcutter, back of a length at off stump. Driven back on the up, very hard, but the bowler gets low to stop it
slapped! It's a slower ball at a good length, on a slow pitch, outside off stump. Not my problem, says Jadhav as he picks it neatly over the midwicket boundary
full at middle stump, nice clip off the toes as he walks across the stumps, but he can't get it past short fine
slower short ball outside off stump, stops Dhoni's charge and forces him to respectfully fend it to point for a single
Jadhav charges another bouncer, gets cramped and gets another top edge. There is a square leg this time unlike before, but he gets it into the open midwicket area
full ball outside off stump, poked into the off side
back of a length outside off stump, a big heave from Dhoni ends up a toe-ended pull to long-on. He's disappointed with himself

oh what a freak this guy is. Batting stances are over-rated. Jadhav is waiting on his back knee like he wants to put a ring on this ball before it is delivered. It's good length outside off stump and it's perfect for him. He's planned this all along. Can't get any more under it as he sweeps this over square leg
low full toss at middle stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
legcutter, short and down leg side. Dhoni exposes all his stumps as he looks to pull this, but he misses out
short and wide outside off stump, tries to club this over the off side boundaries, but it's a thick slice that Bishoo can only get to on the bounce from sweeper cover
full ball at off stump, goes hard with the drive, gets it off the bottom of the bat to long-on
whack...but Bishoo is on a mission to keep Dhoni quiet today. This time he's quickly across to his right at sweeper cover as Dhoni gets all of a drive on the up to a length ball
can't get bat on this bouncer. He was backing away, he got followed, and he awkwardly fell to the floor as he avoided it
sweet. Doesn't back away too much this time, just gets the front leg out of the way, makes room and is gifted with a length ball at middle stump. Duly lifts it inside-out past mid-off
another bouncer, again he's forced to get out of the way. Good comeback
ah, Kesrick. He's done everything right. Another bouncer has Jadhav in trouble with feet pointed in different directions, face pointed skywards and an angled bat. It's four over the keeper
slower short ball outside off, Jadhav has to reach out to get bat on it, bunts it towards mid-off
shot. Mid-off is in, the length ball arrives. It's a slower one. No worries. He waits, then he reaches out and lofts it wide of the fielder in the infield to push India past 250
full, pitching just outside off and slanting further away with a bit of away swing. Left alone

back of a length on off stump, goes back and across to push to the right of midwicket. A little risky, given that Jadhav throws right-handed, and Lewis was gone had his throw hit direct at the bowler's end
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
ooh, good ball. Late inswing towards off stump. Hope keeps his head nice and still and clips through backward square leg to pick up his first run
back of a length in the corridor, a bit of extra bounce. Jabs away from his body, slightly, and gets a thickish edge down to third man
length ball close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
full, some swing, but it swings a long way down the leg side
shortens his length slightly, but the line is still too straight. Swings down the leg side and Dhoni, stretching to his right to try and stop it, gets hit on the fingertips
back of a length, some swing in towards off stump, defended towards cover point

bowled him, that's an absolute beauty. Hits just the right length, swings back in, and hits off stump as Lewis, jumping back and across and still on the move, jabs hurriedly, bat coming down from gully and creating a gap for the ball to sneak through. That was quick, close to 142kph, and Lewis was late on the ball. Kept slightly low too, but he should have been going forward, considering the length
length ball swinging away in the corridor, left alone
once again, big outswing in the corridor outside off. Hope leaves alone
and again, Shai Hope leaves a perfectly pitched outswinger pitching just outside off stump
good ball, a little shorter and hurring on towards off stump, no swing this time. Jumps up and tucks it away through backward square leg
length ball swinging in towards off stump. Feels for the ball a little, but plays with soft hands, and it rolls away off the outside half of the bat towards third man
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length again, fifth-stump line, jabbed away to third man

once again, back of a length. Punches firmly into the covers and takes off. Kyle wants a single, Shai doesn't. Kohli moves quickly to his left from cover, spins around, and throws at the keeper's end. Kyle is a long way out, but the throw misses
still back of a length, some inswing towards the thigh pad, tucked into the backward square leg region

oh, beauty. Length ball swinging in, pitching just outside off, and straightening ever so slightly. Shai Hope doesn't do too much wrong, plays for the swing, looking to defend towards mid-off, and it zips past his outside edge
back of a length, curves away late away from off stump, left alone

back of a length, angling into the legs, worked into the square leg region. Looks like he missed, and it rolled off the thigh pad. Given that there are three slips, it went into a big vacant area, with only mid-on and long leg on the leg side
a little fuller in the corridor, some away shape. Left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, driven to mid-off
angles down the leg side now, pitching just back of a length. Umesh may have been looking for a bit of swing to take it towards the stumps
back to that tight line just outside off, and Hope leaves it alone
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length, some swing in towards off stump, defended into the point region
shortish, tucking Hope up for room. Jumps up to try and work it leg side, the ball rolls off the thigh pad towards midwicket
shot. Just a bit of width, and a touch short as well. Stands tall and punches between backward point and cover point
back of a length outside off, punched to short extra-cover
shortish, swinging in towards middle and leg, jabbed down to midwicket
short, rising ball in the corridor. Jumps to ride the bounce and defend down towards point. He's looked quite comfortable so far, Kyle Hope, apart from that mix-up
shot. Length ball swinging away just a touch in the channel outside off. Waits, shows the full face, and punches down the ground. Mid-off does well to dive to his right and stop it
back of a length, close to off stump, jabbed back towards the bowler
shortish, not a lot of width, stays next to the line and chops it down to backward point
full, no swing this time, angles down the leg side. He's been swinging it from off stump, but not from middle and leg. That's why that magic ball is so difficult to bowl
back of a length on middle stump, punched to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, lets it come on and defends to cover point
back of a length, a bit of inswing to deny room. Wants to punch through cover but can only punch it back to the bowler

all those dot balls has led to a false shot. Falls in no-man's land, thankfully for Hope. Looks to hook from well outside off, gets a thick outside edge that drops down a long way to the left of third man
back of a length outside off, blocked into the point region

short, a bit of width, and Ashwin's diving effort at third man isn't quite good enough to stop this. Deliberately cuts in the air, over backward point. Ashwin gets a hand to it with a dive to the right, but it bursts out of his fingers and rolls into the rope
length ball close to off stump, and that's nicely played. Lets it come on and pushes towards mid-on, putting just enough weight on that shot to give himself time to scurry to the other end
shortish, just a bit of width, and that's a super shot from Shai Hope. Rocks back, flat-bats it hard, and finds the gap to the right of cover point
back of a length, and Umesh slants one down the leg side, not for the first time today
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of mid-off
straighter now, on middle and leg, goes back and punches with a straight bat to the right of mid-on
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away through backward square leg
short, angling into middle stump and tucking up Kyle. Jumps, stays leg-side of the ball, and chops it down into the covers
back of a length, close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length, a bit of swing in towards off and middle, punched to mid-on
bouncer, well directed, rising over off stump. Shai Hope quickly ducks under it
back of a length again, angling into off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length again, outside off this time, punched to cover point
once again, back of a length. The little bit of inward movement he's getting is ensuring Hope doesn't get any width. Shows the full face and punches it back to the bowler
same length, a bit of extra bounce this time. Wants to push into the covers or towards mid-off. Gets an inside edge, off the high part of the bat, and it rolls down into the square leg region
full now, just outside off with a bit of away swing. Hope takes only a short front-foot stride, ends up driving away from his body. Inside-edges into his pad
short, rising ball close to off stump, jumps to ride the bounce and defend with soft hands
back of a length, angling into middle and off, defended into the covers
and Hope edges this into the gap to that gully fielder's left. Back of a length again, a bit of away movement and bounce. He jabs at it without much footwork and gets a thick edge
fuller and straighter now, angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball on middle and off, defended into the covers
starts off with a wide full ball, driven to deep point
back of a length, some width again, punched out to deep point
oh my, that's an awful shot. Length ball, fifth-stump line, and he looks to slog it over mid-on. Hoick and miss
digs it in short now, and that's not the most perfectly controlled pull. Top-edges it, but it still goes quite a distance, bouncing a few yards from the rope between long leg and deep square leg
fullish outside off, left alone
shortish outside off, and that's a nicely timed back-foot stab, hits firmly into the ground and it bounces up above backward point's head. Does well to reach overhead and stop it, Rahane the fielder
full on leg stump, driven inside-out to the left of long-off
length ball turning in towards middle and leg, defended to midwicket
a bit of drift across towards off stump, hangs in the air and drops on a good length. Defended to short extra-cover
drops it short now, turns sharply in to cramp Hope, who was looking to pull. Adjusts and works it to deep backward square leg
full on middle stump, defended to midwicket

ah, beauty. Lovely, lovely delivery. Floated up across the right-hander, achieves some away-drift too. Comes forward to defend, playing for the stock ball, but this is the wrong'un and it spins past his outside edge
short, rising ball in the corridor. Was looking initially to jump up and cut, but it just kept climbing steeply, and he adjusted and dropped his wrists under the ball
back of a length close to off, punched to deep point

lucky runs. Bouncer outside off, and Kyle shapes to hook initially before deciding to leave. He left the bat pointing up, though, and it hits the edge and flies to the fine leg boundary. Could have gone anywhere

this time he does go for the hook, taking it from over his right shoulder, and only manages a top-edge that drops into the hands of deep square leg, who walks a few yards in from the rope and takes it comfortably
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
shortish, close to off stump, lets it come on and guides to third man
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off. Chase had to wait to read the drift before he could plant his front foot

there's the googly again, and India have appealed for a stumping. Beautifully bowled again, the length was just perfect. Stretches out, reaches in front of his body to defend, and the ball spins past his outside edge. He's stretched out a long way, but his toes are planted just about firmly enough, behind the crease
length ball turning in towards leg stump. Looked like Hope picked it off the pitch. Pressed forward, then withdrew his pad away from the line to work it into the square-leg region

oh my, that was just brilliant. Not the greatest shot from Chase, though. It's a shot he takes on even against the legspinners, trusting his reach to be able to whip balls against the turn through midwicket, but here it went all wrong - firstly, I don't think he picked the googly, and that meant he was playing down the wrong line and off balance. The ball spun past his shot and hit off stump. Did I mention playing down the wrong line - it's also because it drifted a long way from outside leg and pitched just about on leg stump
wrong'un outside off, defended off the back foot
too full now, flighted liberally and pitching outside off, driven confidently to the cover boundary
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point
back of a length, a bit of inward seam movement towards off stump, punched away through cover point
short, fairly wide outside off, left alone. Wasn't too far from the tramline
back of a length outside off, punched to backward point
bouncer, Hope ducks low to evade it
back of a length in the corridor, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend into the point region
back of a length outside off, defended to backward point
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
tossed up on leg stump, comes forward to defend and it spins past his inside edge to hit front pad
tossed up on off stump this time, blocked back to the bowler
quicker and flatter, pitching on off stump and turning in. Goes back to work it to leg slip
tossed up outside leg, swept to deep backward square leg
tossed up full on off stump, a lovely big stride out, head right over the ball, to drive to long-off
nicely bowled, full with some drift away towards middle and off, defended into the covers
back of a length at off stump, very late back foot defence crashes into the floor, and goes straight to point
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side on the up
short and way down the leg side...and Dhoni lets a regulation take through. Umesh sprints to his right at fine leg and puts in a full-blooded dive to keep it to two
back of a length outside off, cross-seam so it skids through low...under the attempted punch

near-perfect bouncer and that's the end of Shai Hope. He's angry with himself. It was an ordinary shot, but a very well-directed short one from Hardik. Shai was late on the hook as he tried to pick it from in front of his right shoulder. Top-edge onto helmet and an easy lobbed catch for Hardik
fierce bouncer in the corridor, left well alone
good length outside off stump. The kind of sucker delivery that might been pushed aerially by a shorter batsman, but Holder's reach allows him to squeeze the drive past point on the up
back of a length at middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length, middle stump, tucked off the back foot to deep midwicket
back of a length at the hips, and the leg glance lands short of leg slip
good length, pitches on leg stump, spins past the sweep and Dhoni as well...trickles to the fine leg boundary and is given runs
wrong'un, picked off the pitch from a good length and defended. Dhoni was down leg side with that one. This guy is difficult to pick
short and wide outside off stump, no need to try and pick the direction of that. Only has to decide where to put it, and he sends it to the deep cover boundary with a cut
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended on the up to point
balance. Stands tall, times this push past mid-off. Regulation good length ball outside off
bouncer doesn't climb too much, Holder swivels and runs it down to fine leg with a pull
back of a length outside off stump, half-prod, half-leave, full edge. Down to third man for a single
bouncer outside off stump, big Holder sways away from it easily
back of a length, off stump, punched to extra cover
good length, middle stump, flicked behind square on the leg side
nicely drifted away, good length, off stump, respectfully defended

a stumping appeal down the leg side. It's a wide, Holder was down and he looks very out. It's been referred. Yes, the foot wasn't down. It was a poor delivery, short and spinning down leg. Dhoni gathers, whips the bails off, and then appeals for a caught behind too - the straight umpire only signals wide. Hardik Pandya at square leg has a big smile when the leg umpire makes the signal for a replay
good length, pushed flat at middle stump, defended back down the pitch
good length at leg stump, makes him reach out and beats him down the leg side. Another wide
back of a length at middle stump, tucked behind square off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, pushed straight to square leg
good length at leg stump, glanced off the back foot to deep square
good length, tossed up outside off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length outside off stump, spins back in, too short. He's onto the back foot to punch it to long-on
wrong'un, pushed through quickly outside off stump. Inside half of the bat as he defends away from the body
tossed up outside off stump, driven to long-on with the turn
good length, middle stump, well-connected sweep, finds long leg
good length, pushed flat outside off stump, poked into the off side off the front foot

Caught behind and it's been reviewed. Arm ball from Ashwin, drifts away with the seam position. Seems to beat the outside edge, but keeper and slip are confident. Well, they're wrong. Snicko shows no disturbance and this will be overturned. Very good delivery, took off from a length outside off stump, and there was no noticeable change in the hand from Ashwin
good length at leg stump, brushes the pad and runs away fine
good length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side
good length at middle stump, poked into the leg side off the front foot
another arm ball. Not picked once more. Full outside off and it takes the leading edge to run away to cover's left
low full toss at middle stump, bunted back to the bowler who gets down lazily and misfields
good length at off stump, defended off the front foot
short at off stump, chopped out to sweeper cover
wrong'un, good length, picks it off the pitch and pushes it behind square on the off side
good length at middle stump, swept out to long leg
good length, regulation wristpinner at middle stump, and he uses the turn to place this expansive sweep wide of deep midwicket
good length, leg stump, defended into the leg side side
good length, middle stump, pushed through flat, defended off the back foot
tossed up, good length at leg stump, thick inside edge as he pushes forward to defend this
back of a length at off stump, punched out to sweeper cover
arm ball, full and outside off stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, solidly behind the line to defend this into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at off stump, slight shape in, defended off the front foot
bouncer outside off stump, he thinks about stabbing at it, decides against. Lets it go
back of a length at middle stump, gets in a poor position for the pull, but mistimes it well enough to fetch two to deep square leg's left
140kph, good length outside off stump. All his life coaches might have told him to bowl that delivery. Today he draws an edge too. But it runs away to the third man boundary
back of a length at off stump, gets on his toes to defend this into the off side
good length, fired in fast at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket's right off the back foot
76 kph, floated right up at leg stump, paddled - off the top edge - to fine leg's right
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length, middle stump, forward defence down the pitch
good length, off stump, defended off the back foot
nice...from the bowler anyway. Good length at off stump, draws him forward and gets an outside edge. Rahane gets down too slowly at backward point
aw, come on. Quick and short at middle stump, he's looking towards the square leg boundary as he swats across the line, and gets a leading edge that goes past the keeper
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
again. This time the edge goes higher and swerves towards fine leg after starting at a first slip kind of line. It's four more over the keeper as he looks to pull this from off stump
good length, fired down the leg side. He looks to flick and gets a pad on it. Through to Dhoni who appeals. Not out
back of a length at off stump, hurriedly defended into the off side
good length at off stump, back foot defence
good length at leg stump, forced off the back foot to square leg
good length at leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep square
full ball at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg
good length at off stump, looks to drop this into the off side for a quick single, hits it too well
good length at off stump, inside edge onto pad as he defends
short and slightly wide outside off stump. Gets it to bounce as well, but the cut is nicely controlled and placed well to sweeper cover's left
bouncer pitches outside off and dips in at the batsman, who sways backwards and leaves it alone
creamed. That could well be the first controlled pull shot of the day. Short at off stump and he climbs into this off the front foot and slaps it through midwicket
and he lets the next bouncer go, similar line to the last ball
glorious. Hardik bowls the full delivery, Powell is wary of the change up. Plants the front leg down to reach this outside off stump, and maintains the balance as he lifts this over mid-off
good length outside off stump, left alone. Why wouldn't he? 8 off the over already
back of a length, nips in and thuds into the thigh guard as he looks to defend, possibly via glove
good length, pushed flat at off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length outside off stump, spins it back in sharply, cramps him on the cut
good length, drifts away and pitches outside off, sheepish defence back to the bowler
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length, leg stump, pushed to square leg off the back foot
good length, leg stump, defended to midwicket
tossed up at middle stump, skewed drive off the inside half to midwicket
full toss at leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right...where Kohli puts in a mega-dive and releases the ball quickly after reaching it
good length at middle stump, defended aerially down the pitch
wrong'un, good length at middle stump. Goes for the big sweep, misses it and he's crouched as this hits him on the back in front of middle stump. Rules not out, no review taken
wrong'un, good length, off stump, beats him on the outside edge
good length at leg stump, driven to long-on
carrom ball, full outside off stump. Angled bat offered, leading edge found.
another carrom ball, full at middle stump, poked nervously off the front foot
good length, pushed flat at leg stump and he catches his pads. Appeals loudly and isn't aware of the run out opportunity at the non-striker's end. Misses the throw. Batsman was short
good length at leg stump, shovelled behind square on the leg side
back of a length, flat at off stump, squeezed through cover point off the back foot with exposed stumps
full outside off stump, gets the front leg out of the way to try and hammer this through the off side, can't connect. Finds extra cover
wrong'un, but too short. Picked off middle stump, pushed to midwicket's right
full, leg stump and he misses the drive. Hits him on the back leg and the appeal is turned down. That was going down leg
good length at middle stump, defended off the inside half of the bat

holes out. The pressure was built, the time was ripe for a wrong'un, and pop it came. Good length, turning away from off stump, and climbing too steeply for that slog sweep. Hardik calls from long leg and deep midwicket allows him to get under it and pouch it comfortably
wrong'un, pitches outside leg stump and climbs from a length, awkwardly fended into the leg side
good length, pushed flat at middle stump. He walks across and plays this off middle stump, very late. Yuvraj forced to dive to his right at short fine
no messing around from Nurse. Gets a nice drifted full ball outside off, gets to the pitch and lifts it past mid-off
full, flat middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at off stump, forward defence
back of a length, down leg side
good length at off stump, sharp turn in, gets the inside half of the bat on the defence
short and moving away from the right hander who slices it behind square on the off side

Umesh dives and holds on to his left. That's a very very good catch. This is tossed up at middle stump and it dips at Nurse, who is only worried about sending this flying over the midwicket boundary. He can't reach the ball and gets it off the inside half of a turning bat. Umesh leaps to his left at square leg to hold on to this
back of a length, turns in to cramp Mohammed, punched back to the bowler
fuller, on leg stump, blocked to midwicket
on off stump now, slower, goes deep in his crease to dab into the cover point region
length ball pitching outside leg and turning back into the stumps, Bishoo plays back, looks to flick, and the ball hits him on the pad
back of a length, turns away from the left-hander's off stump, goes back to punch to deep point
tossed up on off stump and Mohammed pushes to mid-off for the quick single
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to the right of midwicket

oh, that's a beauty. Did it turn enough, though? Sliding down leg, I think. Loads of drift into the left-hander from around the wicket to strike pad. Didn't seem to straighten enough as he looked to drive to mid-off, played outside the line
not quite short enough to cut, plays and misses
tossed up now, defended back to the bowler
arm ball now, drifting in towards off stump, comes forward to defend and it hits the inside half of the bat
a bit slower now and Bishoo sweeps it away to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, shows the full face to drive down to long-off
short, rocks back and pulls in the air, but on the bounce, to long-on
shortish on off stump, chopped away to the left of sweeper cover
googly, doesn't really turn, goes with the angle towards off stump and he goes on the back foot to defend

oh no. Mohammed was looking good, and now he's out to a poor choice of shot. Looks to sweep from the stumps, and goes after one that's too full. It hits his front foot almost on the full. Yorked the boot. He's called for a review, but this just looked plumb on first viewing... No inside-edge. Pitches on middle, straightening to hit low on middle, and it's even plumber after ball-tracking has its say
googly, flighted nicely outside off. Comes forward to defend and the inside edge pops up into the vacant short leg region. Kuldeep finishes with 3-41. He took three in the previous game too
there's that swinging arm ball again. Plays back to a fairly full ball, blocks to midwicket
play and miss, looks to stab at one that's a little shorter outside off, but it wasn't short enough

gone, that's Ashwin's 150th in ODIs. An excellent delivery to bring up the milestone. Cummins was playing everything off the back foot, and Ashwin bowled that arm ball again. It was too full to be playing back to, and by the time the bat came down in defence, it had slid through and struck his back pad in front of middle stump

oh, good ball. A bit of away-drift late in its flight even though it was fairly flat, on off and middle. Came forward, defended slightly inside the line, and the ball rolled towards backward point off the outside half of the bat
back of a length, that arm ball again, swinging towards off stump. Nicely back and across to defend
tossed up slower, just outside off, stretches out and defends with soft hands

the man has a golden arm, and he strikes first ball to finish off this match. Nicely bowled, a bit of drift away from the right-hander, who plays inside the line while defending. Beats the outside edge but spins back just enough to hit off stump
